title: Ranked is Nothing but a Nightmare
body:
Only recently have I tried out Ranked Games in LoL, as I mainly stick to Draft Normal and Team Builder... and the rumors I've heard are true... this is nothing but nightmare fuel. From people choosing Revive and Teleport so they can go feed the enemy team quicker, to people who AFK/Leave randomly, or when you ban someone's favorite champion and they go BALLISTIC and end up... feeding the enemy team... this is horrible. Now, I know these topics have been posted a million and one times but, damn I thought you people were kidding or they are rare circumstances!

The worst part of all is when you KNOW you have a troll right during champion select. Either the game starts and you have to waste 20 minutes, or you can leave and get a penalty and have to wait. You think Riot would figure out some solution to end this crap. 

*UPDATE* However, I completely understand how difficult is to fix these issues. If you have a scenario when someone leaves because they are mad or DC, you should still lose LP. I know the community has mentioned you shoudln't lose any when this happens, however people WILL exploit this.  Whenever you are about to lose, someone on your team could technically just leave to help prevent his teammates from losing a ton of LP. Not a great idea.

What about people intentially chosing stupid champions with idiotic builds for the sole purpose of trolling? Well, you will end up having a lot of matches not even starting because you'll have a few people who don't like your champion choice or they may think you are "beneath" them, ending up with a lot of people just booting someone for no reason. 

While I don't have solutions to these problems, I do believe Riot should make it a priority to think of some method to prevent this from happening. I know attitude is cleaned up considerably in Gold, late division Platinum and Diamond, but a majority of players start in Bronze/Silver. Why should they have to suffer through these social insane people just to climb to a better elo?

If you are at least trying, I think that's what a majority of people would prefer and expect. However, when your mindset is "I'm going to tank 4 other people's LP because I'm an internet asshole" well then... that's when we have a problem.

Ranked essence is lost over the vast majority of players. 

Ranked is the pinnacle competitive mode. We are suppose to bring our best out here to compete for victory; however, many players are not treating it as such. We are seeing AFK, raging, trolling, ect because people are simply not putting there best forward. For some people, something as small as an inconvenience can cause the player to throw everything out the window.

Coming from Diamond 5, majority of matches are played with all players doing their best. These are the most intense, focused, and ultimately satisfying (win or lose) matches I ever play in LOL. Trolling and such occurs on occasion as expected. My point is that the purpose of ranked definitely there.

The many problems are in the lower tiers. Many people love the good experiences, but simply can't handle the bad the naturally comes with it. A common toxicity is also people's perspective of how good they really are (tier and division position) and can't accept where they really are causing them to lash out.

What it comes down to is us as the community. Riot has influence over how seriously we take ranked by its structuring, but we ultimately determine how seriously we take ranked (and thus determine others as well as our own experiences with ranked). We complain to Riot about ranked but the root of the problem is with us.

And here is the paradox. There will always be a vast majority of worse players then there are better. We can say that Tier Gold and above are the most desired positions (since this is the minimum tier to earn the most season rewards), and Gold use to represent the top 10% of players (now it's top 25% due to saturation on how tiers work).

So how do you get the other 90% (now 75%) to play their best in ranked... when their rank is telling them they are not the best? Riot seems to have tried using the most recent iteration of Ranked to 'soften' the visualization (division and tiers) that they are not the best, but this just lead to the inflation of high end tiers and ultimately devaluing them. At the same time, lower players brainwash themselves from their real position with how they visually see their ranked, which against has been softened with many safeguards.

A lot of people argue going back to the old ELO system, but I would honestly say that most people can't emotionally handle seeing a hard number that solidifies that they are not the best. 

So what is to be done? Personally, I don't know. Riot, being a business, definitely took the right step in softening Ranked by adding floaty divisions and tiers to give the players hope in thinking that they are better then they really are. They need to appeal to the widest audience after all. So the real question is how to further refine this, to make people take ranked seriously, and to add real value back into the tiers.

I started in Silver 1, finishing 7-3 and feeling pretty good. I was demoted twice.

I record games, so I watched the replays, went over entire games thinking what I could do differently, and while, primarily jungling, I'm used to being blamed for every single thing that goes wrong whether I had any conceivable control over it or not, I realized it's just the toxicity, which then affects everyone else. Top lane dies twice, someone decides to say something snarky. Top lane gets upset. Others join in. Somehow I get brought into it, upon which I become very generous with the mute button.

It's not the gameplay that makes Ranked so horrifying. It's what comes before people who intentionally feed, or leave, or in whatever way throw the game with their method of choice. Someone says one criticism a little too harshly and everyone plays far worse as a result.

I've never seen more instances of others assisting the enemy team intentionally than in just a few Ranked games. It's astonishing.

It's exceptionally rare that neither team suffers this, but oh man, those are memorable. Ever been in one of those games when everyone's actually trying as a *team*, remembering that it's a team game, not a contest to see who can get the most kills, being able to differentiate between this and a first-person shooter? Those are what make the game worth it. Even one among 20 normal games is gaming bliss. No toxicity at all, just an almost professional level of teamwork and encouragement. Like it should be.

I've had a games when our team congrats eachother every time we score a kill or an objective and we constantly communicate positioning or tactics. Those are the games I love playing. But the moment you have the ten year old child on your team, you completely forget all the good memories of intelligent teammates as you are constantly called a "N*****" or something racist.

I was just so surprised this happened in rank. I can kind of (sort of?) understand when people troll in normal games, but when people who seriously play rank games to climb the ladder and you are purposely screwing them over for whatever reason you have, is pretty rude and immature.

Yep. I almost always take the jungling role because no one wants it (or support, or whatever is the least popular or not picked by the time it's my turn), so I'm used to getting flamed, reported for things that didn't happen (lots of Verbal Abuse and Offensive Language reports have been sent my way, though if it's automated bots who go over those, I think I'm safe, as I don't use any of the words they could possibly be looking for), basically being blamed when a laner has no idea how to handle the frustration of being the victim of First Blood. As if it doesn't register that they're now weaker than the other laner by a significant margin and hence can not afford to play identically.

While that's a bit tangential, it's a roundabout way of agreeing with you. Maybe if I ever make it to Gold it'll get a little better. Being one game away in Silver 1 and not making that one game by the end of last season hurt.

So, I just finished my last game of the evening. We won. How?

Well... the Zed on the opposing team (I kept ganking/camping him as the jungler) rage quit out. After that, the opposing team Sona kept feeding our ADC... and after that... it was pretty easy.

Now don't get me wrong, I love this game and sometimes the community is awesome. But you would think Riot could allow us the chance to boot someone off the team during champion selection? Of course you will get people who just boot someone off because they don't like their choice... but it's a risk I am willing to take!

I'm seeing a lot of "I was placed here and then got demoted multiple times" complaining posts and I have to say:

Uhh... just because you were placed at Silver 2 or something, doesn't mean that is where you really belong. Since placements work on 10 specific games, you could have gotten lucky in a few of those and gotten placed higher than you deserved. Therefore when you get into normal ranked games, you lose a lot and get demoted... Placements are NOT 100% accurate.

The very opposite could happen and you could get super unlucky in placements and get placed really low... and climb out easily because you are at a higher elo skill level.

People need to stop seeing ranked as some sort of WoW level up system. You can't just get Challenger by playing a lot of games. You have to improve your performance. Just because you get placed at some rank doesn't mean you belong there. Not one bit. Placements are just trying to get you in "sort of" the skill level you belong at. It can't be 100% accurate with such a small sampling of games (10)

Also there are trolls/feeders/afks at all levels of play, so stop using that as an excuse for not being able to climb.

I am fairly certain at high level gold/plat/diamond you get far less people. The point of the post isn't about wanting to climb the latter, it's just bringing up what I have personally experienced over a few games. Of course it's a small sampling of my ranked experience, but I wouldn't imagine a majority of my games would be filled with these sorts of people.
